meanings.definition: Convert (an image or font) into a raster format for display on a computer screen.
meanings.sent1: The graphic designer rasterised the logo for the website.
meanings.sent2: The software rasterised the high-resolution image for online viewing.
meanings.sent3: When the artist tried to rasterise the picture, it turned into a pixelated mess!
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the vacation were rasterised in her mind like a digital painting.
meanings.sent5: The process of rasterising the document made the details clearer than ever before.

meanings.definition: Represent (an image or font) as a set of pixels on a computer screen.
meanings.sent1: To display the photo, the program rasterised it into pixels.
meanings.sent2: The website rasterised the text to ensure it appeared sharp on all devices.
meanings.sent3: The cat video was so pixelated after being rasterised that it looked like a mosaic!
meanings.sent4: His emotions were rasterised on his face, each feeling a different pixel.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes were rasterised on the canvas, creating a digital masterpiece.
